DataElement.preferredName: Visceral Kaposi Sarcoma Lesion Anatomic Location Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the visceral Kaposi sarcoma lesion anatomic location.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Visceral Kaposi Sarcoma Lesion Anatomic Location
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs._A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS)._A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part._Relating to anatomy._A position, site, or point in space where something can be found.

Concepts.definition: Of, or relating to, or affecting the internal organs.

A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
